Url.Title: Welcome
Url.Abstract: Welcome to the DB Distributor Item Management Online Help. While you're working in DB Distributor's Item Management module, you can press the F1 key at any time to access the online help for the currently displayed panel or tab. Use the following toolbar buttons to navigate this help system: Home ...

Url.Title: About Print Management
Url.Abstract: The phrase "Item Management" is generally used to describe the services that a distributor will perform above and beyond the typical order processing functions. This includes items analysis, on-site counts, warehousing and distribution, along with other services. The Item Management module is used ...

Url.Title: Print Management Setup
Url.Abstract: Item Management Setup In order to use the Item Management module as intended, you will need to perform the initial system setup and the setup of your customers and their items, in the specific order presented as follows: Initial System Setup System Parameters IM Customer Setup Required ...

Url.Title: PM Customer - Processing Controls
Url.Abstract: IM Customer - Processing Controls The processing controls allows you to setup how this customer, and their items, will function within the Item Management module. Field Description Last Completed IMS Year/Period Available options: 01 to 13, This parameter identifies the period in which IM ...

Url.Title: PM Customer - Item Master Defaults
Url.Abstract: IM Customer - Item Master Defaults The item master defaults will be used as defaults on new items that are setup for this customer and are marked as IMS items. Field Description IMS Flag Y or N. Should new items setup for this customer default to being a IM item? Restocking Status Should this be ...

Url.Title: Ship-to Location - Address Information
Url.Abstract: Ship-to Location - Address Information The address information area is used for adding the standard address information for this location code. Follow these steps to complete this panel: Enter in a name if there is a specific name associated with this location. Enter in the physical address ...

Url.Title: Ship-to Location - Items Management
Url.Abstract: Ship-to Location - Items Management The items management area is used to add information about how Item Management items should be treated that are shipped to this location. Follow these steps to complete this panel: Enter if this location code has an alternate location code used by the ...

Url.Abstract: Ship-to Location - Additional Defaults The additional codes portion of the ship-to location setup will let you setup options similar to those from the customer default data. Url.Title: About Cycle Processing
Url.Abstract: The Cycle Processor is used as a process to update your usage statistics for your Item Management customers and their items. The Cycle Processing will vary in its operation based upon how you have setup your Item Management customers and their items. Here are the main areas that will be covered: ...

Url.Title: Cycle Processor

You can choose to run the cycle for a single customer, ...

Url.Title: Count Sheet Printing
Url.Abstract: Count Sheet Printing DB Distributor > Item Management > Cycle Processing > Count Sheet Printing (F/M P2) For your IM customers that are counted customers, you will need to print count sheets for the locations that you will be performing a physical count at for this cycle. Url.Title: Count Entry

Url.Title: Count Checklist Report
Url.Abstract: Count Checklist Report DB Distributor > Item Management > Cycle Processing > Count Checklist Report (F/M P4) Once all the count information has been entered, this report may be printed. Url.Title: Item Labels

Url.Title: About Reorder Processing
Url.Abstract: DB Distributor provides you with the ability to monitor those items that will soon require reordering from the factory. DB Distributor determines that an item has reached this point based on established reorder points on the Item Master. Along with the ability to monitor these items is the option ...

Url.Title: Inventory Valuation
Url.Abstract: Inventory Valuation DB Distributor > Item Management > Reports > Customers > Inventory Valuation (FMR R6) The Inventory Valuation report will use the on-hand amount from both customer and distributor locations along with cost information to come up with a value for existing inventory. Url.Title: Contacting Us
Url.Abstract: Contacting Us DemandBridge, Inc. 3500 Parkway Lane Suite 300 Norcross, GA 30092 Sales: 800.448.1484 Technical Services & Support: 770.239.7777 Support Web Page: Customer Service Center

Url.Title: Effect of Count Date
Url.Abstract: Effect of Count Date When items are counted, DB Distributor calculates usage based on the current physical count and date, and the last physical count and date. After calculating the usage that has occurred since the last count, DB Distributor will distribute this usage between the two count ...

Url.Title: Negative Usage
Url.Abstract: Negative Usage You may encounter situations where shipment of an item has reached your customer's location but has not yet been fully processed in DB Distributor. In this situation, the count of the item at the customer's location will include the shipment but DB Distributor will not have this ...

Url.Title: Current or Next Shipment
Url.Abstract: Update Usage on Current or Next Shipment? This can be set to "Usage on Shipment" (recommended) or "Usage on Next Shipment". This parameter only affects customers that are set as "issue based" instead of "counted". Usage on Shipment - Under this option, usage is recognized as soon as a ...

Url.Title: Custom Item Setup - Alternate U/M
Url.Abstract: Custom Item Setup - Alternate U/M Follow these steps to complete this panel: If you have enabled use of the Customer Item Code, you may enter an alternate item code for this item, up to 20 characters. If inventory for this item is kept under a different customer code, enter the customer code in ...

Url.Title: Custom Item Setup - Pricing
Url.Abstract: Custom Item Setup - Pricing Follow these steps to complete this panel: Enter in a selling unit of measure, quantity per that unit of measure, and sell price per that unit of measure. Enter in a cost unit of measure, quantity per that unit of measure, and the cost per that unit of measure. Select ...

Url.Title: Custom Item Setup - Reorder
Url.Abstract: Custom Item Setup - Reorder Follow these steps to complete this panel: Enter in your reorder information: Suggested Reorder Quantity - You can enter a suggested reorder quantity that you wish to print on the customers reorder notice. A reorder point can be reached by setting any of the following ...

Url.Title: Custom Item Setup - Main Setup
Url.Abstract: Custom Item Setup - Main Setup Follow these steps to complete this panel: Enter a valid product code , or select one from the lookup. Optionally, enter in left to right and top to bottom dimensions. Optionally, enter in a number of plys. Note: Ply information will only be used if you have ...

Url.Title: Customer Location Data

Url.Title: Report Options
Url.Abstract: Item Management Report Codes Each item management report has a code that describes it. The code is the menu code that is used for the report on the CHUI menu. Field Description Price If desired, enter a price for this charge. Note: based on what you select in the "Calculation Method" field will determine if the number ...

Url.Title: Update in Current Period
Url.Abstract: Update Issues Based Usage in Current Period? This parameter only affects customers that are set as "issue based" instead of "counted". This can be set to Yes or No. This parameter works in conjunction with the previous parameter (Method of updating Issues based usage). If the previous parameter ...

Url.Title: Update Out of Date in Current Period
Url.Abstract: Update Out-of-Date Usage in Current Period? This parameter is concerned with the effect of shipments which have ship dates prior to the most recent ship date. This situation generally arises when returns are entered. This parameter only effects processing if both of the following are true: The ...
